resources.string: Use parallel queries to speed up resolving by querying all upstream servers simultaneously.
Query one upstream server at a time. AdGuard Home uses its weighted random algorithm to pick the server so that the fastest server is used more often.
Bootstrap DNS servers are used to resolve IP addresses of the DoH/DoT resolvers you specify as upstreams.

The DNS servers that AdGuard Home uses for local PTR queries. These servers are used to resolve PTR requests for addresses in private IP ranges, for example \"192.168.12.34\", using reverse DNS. If not set, AdGuard Home uses the addresses of the default DNS resolvers of your OS except for the addresses of AdGuard Home itself.
By default, AdGuard Home uses the following reverse DNS resolvers: {{ip}}.
AdGuard Home could not determine suitable private reverse DNS resolvers for this system.
Enter one server address per line
Enable reverse resolving of clients\' IP addresses

Reversely resolve clients\' IP addresses into their hostnames by sending PTR queries to corresponding resolvers (private DNS servers for local clients, upstream servers for clients with public IP addresses).

Perform reverse DNS lookups for locally served addresses using these upstream servers. If disabled, AdGuard Home responds with NXDOMAIN to all such PTR requests except for clients known from DHCP, /etc/hosts, and so on.
AdGuard Home cannot run a DHCP server on your OS
If your router does not provide DHCP settings, you can use AdGuard\'s own built-in DHCP server.

It is safe to enable the built-in DHCP server because AdGuard Home didn\'t find any active DHCP servers on the network. However, you should re-check that manually as the automatic probing doesn\'t currently provide a 100% guarantee.
An active DHCP server is found on the network. It is not safe to enable the built-in DHCP server.
Invalid IPv4 address of the gateway
ClientID must contain only numbers, lowercase letters, and hyphens
Subnet \"{{cidr}}\" does not contain the IP address \"{{ip}}\"
Lease can\'t have the IP address of the gateway
Must be lower than range start
Must be greater than range start
Addresses must be in one subnet
If you want to enable DHCP server anyway, make sure that there is no other active DHCP server in your network, as this may break the Internet connectivity for devices on the network!
AdGuard Home could not determine if there is another active DHCP server on the network

In order to use DHCP server a static IP address must be set. AdGuard Home failed to determine if this network interface is configured using a static IP address. Please set a static IP address manually.

Your system uses dynamic IP address configuration for interface <0>{{interfaceName}}</0>. In order to use DHCP server, a static IP address must be set. Your current IP address is <0>{{ipAddress}}</0>. AdGuard Home will automatically set this IP address as static if you press the \"Enable DHCP server\" button.
Are you sure you want to reset all leases?
Are you sure you want to reset the DHCP configuration?
Are you sure you want to delete \"{{key}}\"?
The statistics have been disabled. You can turn it on from the <0>settings page</0>.
The number of DNS queries processed for the last {{count}} day
The number of DNS queries processed for the last {{count}} days
The number of DNS queries processed for the last 24 hours
The number of DNS requests blocked by adblock filters and hosts blocklists
The number of DNS requests blocked by the AdGuard browsing security module
The number of adult websites blocked
The number of DNS requests to search engines for which Safe Search was enforced
Average time in milliseconds on processing a DNS request
Block domains using filters and hosts files
You can setup blocking rules in the Filters settings.
Use AdGuard browsing security web service

AdGuard Home will check if the domain is blocked by the browsing security web service. It will use privacy-friendly lookup API to perform the check: only a short prefix of the domain name SHA256 hash is sent to the server.
Use AdGuard parental control web service
AdGuard Home will check if domain contains adult materials. It uses the same privacy-friendly API as the browsing security web service.
AdGuard Home will enforce safe search in the following search engines: Google, YouTube, Bing, DuckDuckGo, Yandex, Pixabay.
AdGuard Home will block domains matching the blocklists.
Domains from DNS allowlists will be allowed even if they are in any of the blocklists.
Enter one server address per line. Learn more about configuring upstream DNS servers.
AdGuard Home understands basic adblock rules and hosts files syntax.
Enter a URL or an absolute path of the list
Enter a valid URL to the blocklist.
Enter a valid URL to the allowlist.
Invalid URL or absolute path of the list
Enter one rule on a line. You can use either adblock rules or hosts files syntax.
block access to example.org and all its subdomains;
unblock access to example.org and all its subdomains;
respond with 127.0.0.1 for example.org (but not for its subdomains);
block access to domains matching the specified regular expression.
encrypted DNS-over-HTTPS with forced <0>HTTP/3</0> and no fallback to HTTP/2 or below;
Specified DNS servers are working correctly
Server \"{{key}}\": could not be used, please check that you\'ve written it correctly
Upstream \"{{key}}\" does not respond to test requests and may not work properly
Rule removed from the custom filtering rules: {{rule}}
Rule added to the custom filtering rules: {{rule}}
Are you sure you want to clear the entire query log?
The query log has been successfully cleared
The query log has been successfully updated
The query log is disabled and can be configured in the <0>settings</0>
Use double quotes for strict search
Are you sure you want to change query log rotation? If you decrease the interval value, some data will be lost
Don\'t save the client\'s full IP address to logs or statistics
Here you can configure DNS cache
Clients can be identified by ClientID. Learn more about how to identify clients here.
Add the EDNS Client Subnet option (ECS) to upstream requests and log the values sent by the clients in the query log.
Allow to use custom IP for EDNS
The number of requests per second allowed per client. Setting it to 0 means no limit.
IP address to be returned for a blocked A request
IP address to be returned for a blocked AAAA request
Default: Respond with zero IP address (0.0.0.0 for A; :: for AAAA) when blocked by Adblock-style rule; respond with the IP address specified in the rule when blocked by /etc/hosts-style rule
Null IP: Respond with zero IP address (0.0.0.0 for A; :: for AAAA)
Custom IP: Respond with a manually set IP address
If you keep this field empty, AdGuard Home will use the servers configured in the <0>DNS settings</0>.
Found in the known domains database.
AdGuard Home is a network-wide ad-and-tracker blocking DNS server. Its purpose is to let you control your entire network and all your devices, and it does not require using a client-side program.
Your AdGuard Home admin web interface will be available on the following addresses:
You will need to configure your devices or router to use the DNS server on the following addresses:

Password authentication to your AdGuard Home admin web interface must be configured. Even if AdGuard Home is accessible only in your local network, it is still important to protect it from unrestricted access.
To start using AdGuard Home, you need to configure your devices to use it.
The setup procedure is complete and you\'re now ready to start using AdGuard Home.
This setup automatically covers all devices connected to your home router, no need to configure each of them manually.
AdGuard Home DNS server is listening on the following addresses

Open the preferences for your router. Usually, you can access it from your browser via a URL, such as http://192.168.0.1/ or http://192.168.1.1/. You may be prompted to enter a password. If you don\'t remember it, you can often reset the password by pressing a button on the router itself, but be aware that if this procedure is chosen, you will probably lose the entire router configuration. If your router requires an app to set it up, please install the app on your phone or PC and use it to access the router’s settings.
Find the DHCP/DNS settings. Look for the DNS letters next to a field which allows two or three sets of numbers, each broken into four groups of one to three digits.
Enter your AdGuard Home server addresses there.

On some router types, a custom DNS server cannot be set up. In that case, setting up AdGuard Home as a <0>DHCP server</0> may help. Otherwise, you should check the router manual on how to customize DNS servers on your specific router model.
Open Control Panel through Start menu or Windows search.
Go to Network and Internet category and then to Network and Sharing Center.
In the left panel, click \"Change adapter settings\".
Right-click your active connection and select Properties.
Find \"Internet Protocol Version 4 (TCP/IPv4)\" (or, for IPv6, \"Internet Protocol Version 6 (TCP/IPv6)\") in the list, select it and then click on Properties again.
Choose \"Use the following DNS server addresses\" and enter your AdGuard Home server addresses.
Click the Apple icon and go to System Preferences.
Select the first connection in your list and click Advanced.
Select the DNS tab and enter your AdGuard Home server addresses.
From the Android Menu home screen, tap Settings.
Tap Wi-Fi on the menu. The screen listing all of the available networks will be shown (it is impossible to set custom DNS for mobile connection).
Long press the network you\'re connected to, and tap Modify Network.
On some devices, you may need to check the box for Advanced to see further settings. To adjust your Android DNS settings, you will need to switch the IP settings from DHCP to Static.
Change DNS 1 and DNS 2 values to your AdGuard Home server addresses.
From the home screen, tap Settings.
Choose Wi-Fi in the left menu (it is impossible to configure DNS for mobile networks).
Tap on the name of the currently active network.
In the DNS field enter your AdGuard Home server addresses.
Encryption (HTTPS/QUIC/TLS) support for both DNS and admin web interface

If set, AdGuard Home detects ClientIDs, responds to DDR queries, and performs additional connection validations. If not set, these features are disabled. Must match one of the DNS Names in the certificate.
If checked, AdGuard Home will automatically redirect you from HTTP to HTTPS addresses.
If HTTPS port is configured, AdGuard Home admin interface will be accessible via HTTPS, and it will also provide DNS-over-HTTPS on \'/dns-query\' location.
If this port is configured, AdGuard Home will run a DNS-over-TLS server on this port.
If this port is configured, AdGuard Home will run a DNS-over-QUIC server on this port.

In order to use encryption, you need to provide a valid SSL certificates chain for your domain. You can get a free certificate on <0>{{link}}</0> or you can buy it from one of the trusted Certificate Authorities.
Copy/paste your PEM-encoded private key for your certificate here.
If encryption is enabled, AdGuard Home admin interface will work over HTTPS, and the DNS server will listen for requests over DNS-over-HTTPS and DNS-over-TLS.
This is a valid {{type}} private key
This is an invalid {{type}} private key
Are you sure you want to reset encryption settings?
Your SSL certificate is about to expire. Update <0>Encryption settings</0>.
Your SSL certificate is expired. Update <0>Encryption settings</0>.
Enter port number in the range of 80-65535
AdGuard Home {{version}} is now available! <0>Click here</0> for more info.
Error checking the DNS server status
Here is a <0>list of known DNS providers</0> to choose from.
Auto-update failed. Please follow these steps to update manually.
Please follow these steps to update manually.
Please wait, AdGuard Home is being updated
Configure persistent client records for devices connected to AdGuard Home
Clients can be identified by their IP address, CIDR, MAC address, or ClientID (can be used for DoT/DoH/DoQ). Learn more about how to identify clients <0>here</0>.
Enter an IP address in the subnet \"{{cidr}}\"
Are you sure you want to delete client \"{{key}}\"?
Are you sure you want to delete this list?
Devices not on the list of Persistent clients that may still use AdGuard Home
Here you can configure access rules for the AdGuard Home DNS server
A list of CIDRs, IP addresses, or ClientIDs. If this list has entries, AdGuard Home will accept requests only from these clients.
A list of CIDRs, IP addresses, or ClientIDs. If this list has entries, AdGuard Home will drop requests from these clients. This field is ignored if there are entries in Allowed clients.

Not to be confused with filters. AdGuard Home drops DNS queries matching these domains, and these queries don\'t even appear in the query log. You can specify exact domain names, wildcards, or URL filter rules, e.g. \"example.org\", \"*.example.org\", or \"||example.org^\" correspondingly.
A new version of AdGuard Home is available
Update check failed. Please check your Internet connection.
<0>Here\'s a list of software you can use.</0>
On an iOS 14 or macOS Big Sur device you can download special \'.mobileconfig\' file that adds DNS-over-HTTPS or DNS-over-TLS servers to the DNS settings.
Android 9 supports DNS-over-TLS natively. To configure it, go to Settings → Network & internet → Advanced → Private DNS and enter your domain name there.
<0>DNSCloak</0> supports <1>DNS-over-HTTPS</1>, but in order to configure it to use your own server, you\'ll need to generate a <2>DNS Stamp</2> for it.
AdGuard Home itself can be a secure DNS client on any platform.
<0>dnsproxy</0> supports all known secure DNS protocols.
You will find more implementations <0>here</0> and <1>here</1>.
In order to use <1>DNS-over-HTTPS</1> or <1>DNS-over-TLS</1>, you need to <0>configure Encryption</0> in AdGuard Home settings.
Are you sure you want to delete DNS rewrite for \"{{key}}\"?
Allows to easily configure custom DNS response for a specific domain name.
Rewritten by the hosts file rule
Enter IP address or domain name
Allows to quickly block popular sites and services.
The list has been successfully added
The list has been successfully removed
The list has been successfully updated
If you decrease the interval value, some data will be lost
Are you sure you want to clear statistics?
Are you sure you want to change statistics retention? If you decrease the interval value, some data will be lost
Queries for these domains are not written to the statistics
Queries for these domains are not written to the query log
Please follow <0>these steps</0> to create a new password for your user account.
<0>Learn more</0> about creating your own hosts lists.
Blocked by CNAME or IP in response
Enter the domain name or wildcard you want to be rewritten.
rewrite responses for this domain name only.
IP address: use this IP in an A or AAAA response
Domain name: add a CNAME record
<0>A</0>: special value, keep <0>A</0> records from the upstream
<0>AAAA</0>: special value, keep <0>AAAA</0> records from the upstream
Drop all DNS queries for IPv6 addresses (type AAAA).

Query all DNS servers and return the fastest IP address among all responses. This slows down DNS queries as AdGuard Home has to wait for responses from all DNS servers, but improves the overall connectivity.
If you click \"Fix\", AdGuard Home will configure your system to use AdGuard Home DNS server.

It will perform these tasks: <0>Deactivate system DNSStubListener</0> <0>Set DNS server address to 127.0.0.1</0> <0>Replace symbolic link target of /etc/resolv.conf with /run/systemd/resolve/resolv.conf</0> <0>Stop DNSStubListener (reload systemd-resolved service)</0>
As a result all DNS requests from your system will be processed by AdGuard Home by default.
You can select tags that correspond to the client. Include tags in filtering rules to apply them more precisely. <0>Learn more</0>.
Check if a host name is filtered.
Not found in your filter lists
Are you sure you want to block the client \"{{ip}}\"?
Are you sure you want to unblock the client \"{{ip}}\"?
AdGuard Home is a server so it needs a static IP address to function properly. Otherwise, at some point, your router may assign a different IP address to this device.
Good news! The static IP address is already configured
AdGuard Home cannot configure it automatically for this network interface. Please look for an instruction on how to do this manually.
AdGuard Home has detected that the dynamic IP address <0>{{ip}}</0> is used. Do you want it to be set as your static address?
AdGuard Home will configure {{ip}} to be your static IP address. Do you want to proceed?
Set DNSSEC flag in the outcoming DNS queries and check the result (DNSSEC-enabled resolver is required).
DNS cache size (in bytes). To disable caching, leave empty.
Extend short time-to-live values (seconds) received from the upstream server when caching DNS responses.
Set a maximum time-to-live value (seconds) for entries in the DNS cache.
Minimum cache TTL override must be less than or equal to the maximum
Make AdGuard Home respond from the cache even when the entries are expired and also try to refresh them.
Lists that block tracking and advertising on most of the devices
Lists designed specifically to block malicious, phishing, and scam domains
Lists that focus on regional ads and tracking servers
Setup configuration to enable DHCP server
Port 53 is often occupied by \"DNSStubListener\" or \"systemd-resolved\" services. Please read <0>this instruction</0> on how to resolve this.
AdGuard Home will be dropping all DNS queries from this client.
WARNING: This action also will exclude the rule \"{{disallowed_rule}}\" from the list of allowed clients.
Cannot disallow this client because excluding the rule \"{{disallowed_rule}}\" will DISABLE \"Allowed clients\" list.
Password must be at least {{value}} characters long
<0>Note:</0> IP anonymization is enabled. You can disable it in <1>General settings</1>.
Are you sure you want to clear DNS cache?
Auto (based on the color scheme of your device)
Ignore this client in query log
